title: Soldier vs Civilian Distinction Under Fire
context: During a debate about the role of hate in activism, @plassoplo argued for filtering divisive emotions while opponents (@bildramer, @megalurk5835) promoted hate as 'powerful energy' and criticized anti-hate stances as weak or disloyal.
pressure: Multiple users attacked @plassoplo's position using loaded language ('parasites,' 'hippies, queers, and cowards') and framing emotional restraint as weakness or betrayal of the cause.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation manifested as @plassoplo maintaining his authentic position on strategic discipline despite social pressure to conform to the group's pro-hate stance.
clean_outcome: @plassoplo responded by highlighting 'the difference between a soldier and a civilian posing as one,' maintaining his core thesis that true discipline avoids unchecked emotions while implicitly critiquing performative revolutionary posturing.
